definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: Boy, it's marvelous. I prefer Neijia to Waijia. Well, who's the forefather of Neijia then?
sentences.chinese: 哇，内家功夫真是神了，我喜欢。谁是它的开山鼻祖？

sentences.english: Lady Murasaki Shikubu's The Tale of Genji is seen as the first of its kind in literature.
sentences.chinese: 紫式部的《源氏物语》被看作是这类文学的开山鼻祖。

sentences.english: Robert Morrison was the first missionary of Protestant Church to do missionary work in China.
sentences.chinese: 马礼逊是基督教新教来华传教的开山鼻祖。

definition: the earliest ancestor/originator (of a tradition, school of thought etc)
representative individual (of a school of thought)
(abbr. for 泰山北斗[Tai4 Shan1 Bei3 dou3]) distinguished figure/doyen/revered authority
fashionable for a while (idiom); all the rage
priority/sth advocated first/refers to ancient tradition: Worship the river first, then the sea.

the not-very-distant past/modern times, excluding recent decades/(in the context of Chinese history) the period from the Opium Wars until the May 4th Movement (mid-19th century to 1919)/capitalist times (pre-1949)
